results.title: Out
results.brief_description: Initially following the trajectory of a car which is taking ‘The Girl’ (Celia Ireland), out to a social function, this short film allows the viewer to be privy to the thought processes of what it means to go “out”. The girl ponders issues such as timing, kissing, a no sex policy, being interesting, making an impression, pit stops, and identifying the highlight of the evening. Cast also includes John Polson and Suzy Dougherty.

results.title: First time afloat
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Intended for the complete newcomer to canoeing, this films shows the importance of never canoeing without a lifejacket. Shows methods of getting afloat, simple paddling strokes, and how to choose a route. Also shows how easy it is to escape from a capsize, and deals with how to land both canoeist and canoe. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Canoeing safely
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Underlines some of the dangers which abound on almost every river and canal and shows ways of taking sensible precautions to avoid these dangers. Topics covered include life; hazards; paddling skills; an ‘H’ rescue; canoe buoyancy aids; weirs; capsize drill; stopper waves; emergency packs; bridges and a ‘T’ rescue.

results.title: Making a canoe
results.creator_credit: Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Two boys, with the help of an adult instructor, make a slalom canoe from glass reinforced plastic. The processes involved are shown step by step. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Basic strokes
results.creator_credit: Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Shot in both still and fast moving water, shows all the simple skills needed to paddle a canoe. Shows forward strokes, sculling draw, slap support, sculling for support, reverse paddle, sweep stroke, draw stroke, low telemark and hanging draw.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Explorer Films

results.title: Fish and chips cooking library. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Simple recipes garnished with humour and a smattering of hints and tips are demonstrated by Peter Doyle of the Sydney restaurant family. He shows you everything you need to know about how to make delicious seafood meals, including how to cook a fish in your dishwasher. The video is accompanied by a recipe booklet which also includes charts which show you which fish to substitute for another, and when particular fish are in season. The video is also time coded so that you can find the recipe you want, quickly and easily.

results.title: First winter
results.creator_credit: John Smith, Roman Kroitor, Sam Grana and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This historical drama features the first winter spent in Canada by a family of Irish immigrants deep in the Ottawa Valley. The year is 1830. Because the father is working in a logging camp, the mother has sole charge of the family. Sickness overtakes her and she dies. The children are left on their own to survive. The film graphically illustrates the enormous hardships endured by the first settlers who had to cope with a climate they were unfamiliar with. Filmed in Algonquin Park.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Smith, Roman Kroitor, Sam Grana and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: First Tuesday: four hours in My Lai [anatomy of a massacre]
results.creator_credit: Kevin Sim, Michael Bilton and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the massacre of villagers (mostly women and children), by U.S. troops at the Vietnamese village of My Lai on March 16, 1968. Survivors, both villagers and soldiers, speak of their experiences, memories and how they have coped since.

results.title: Fire over England
results.creator_credit: William K. Howard, Erich Pommer, Pendennis and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: Historical drama dealing with England’s struggle against the Spanish Armada. Performances by Vivien Leigh, Laurence Olivier, Flora Robson and an early performance by James Mason. Based on the novel by A.E.W. Mason.
